TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed FirstWeekOfYear extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Indicates the first week of the year to use when calling date-related functions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you call date-related functions, you can use the following enumeration members in your code in place of the actual values.
Some date-related functions take a argument, a argument, or both. The `FirstWeekOfYear` enumeration specifies the valid values for the arguments, as well as the possible return values from the functions.
The argument takes the `FirstWeekOfYear` enumeration members.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.FirstWeekOfYear FirstFourDays = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The first week that has at least four days in the new year. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbFirstFourDays`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.FirstWeekOfYear FirstFullWeek = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The first full week of the year. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbFirstFullWeek`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.FirstWeekOfYear Jan1 = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The week in which January 1 occurs (default). This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbFirstJan1`.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.FirstWeekOfYear System = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The weekspecified in your system settings as the first week of the year. This member is equivalent to the Visual Basic constant `vbUseSystem`.
